body:
We at SFT-SPI would like to use libc's implementation of iconv, as opposed to libiconv one. This PR introduces a new virtual package `iconv` and a dummy package `libc` to provide it. 

lib's and libiconv's implementation of iconv should be compatible on API level, but I'm testing this just in case.

Packages that directly depend on libiconv:
- [x] apr-util
- [x] dcmtk
- [x] doxygen
- [x] gdal
- [x] glib
- [x] gnuplot
- [x] gtksourceview
- [x] libgd
- [x] libunistring
- [x] libxslt
- [x] ncl
- [x] procps
- [x] unixodbc
- [x] xerces-c
- [x] bash
- [x] diffutils
- [x] gcc
- [x] git
- [x] gnupg
- [x] grass
- [x] lftp
- [x] libspatialite
- [x] libxml2
- [x] mono
- [x] poppler
- [x] tar
- [x] wget
(re-do of #15213 due to changes in gnupg recipe)
title: Hack to select iconv implementation - libiconv vs. libc iconv
